heisig_chinese_memo: Throughout history horses have helped humans maneuver themselves through difficult situations.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Throughout history horses have helped humans maneuver themselves through difficult situations.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle and seal script start with the sound of " horse " and " history ". The original meaning is horse walking fast, and then it is extended to speed, and it is also extended to drive and drive. The word " history " in oracle bone inscriptions is the same as " official ". "Shuowen New Attachment": "𩢲, Jiye, from the horse, the official voice." " 𩢲 ", "Jade Pian" for driving. "All Classics Sounds and Meanings": "Ancient ambassadors may be used for driving. When driving, horses are fast.

Inscriptions used as horse names are found in "He Ji" 28195 and "He Ji" 28196.

Ancient books are used as the original meaning, such as Emperor Liang Jianwen of the Southern Dynasties "Chunri Wants to Go to the Forest": "Xiang Che Mica, Driving Horse Golden Restraint"; also used for speed, such as Wang Wei "Gift from the Treasurer Waiyu": "Want to join hands with the court slowly" How to drive the fleeting years."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle and seal script start with the sound of " horse " and " history ". The original meaning is horse walking fast, then it is extended to speed, and it is also extended to drive and drive.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文與篆文從「馬」，「史」聲，本義為馬走得快，後引申為疾速，亦引申為行駛、駕駛。甲骨文「史」同「吏」字。《說文新附》：「𩢲，疾也，從馬，吏聲。」「𩢲」，《玉篇》作駛。《一切經音義》：「古使字或作駛。駛，馬行疾也」。

　　卜辭用作馬名，見於《合集》28195與《合集》28196。

　　古書用作本義，如南朝梁簡文帝〈春日想上林〉：「香車雲母幰，駛馬黃金羈」；亦用作疾速，如王維〈贈從第司庫員外絿〉：「欲緩攜手朝，流年一何駛」。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文與篆文從「馬」，「史」聲，本義為馬走得快，後引申為疾速，亦引申為行駛、駕駛。

Kind: traditional

甲骨文與篆文從「 馬 」，「 史 」聲，本義為馬走得快，後引申為疾速，亦引申為行駛、駕駛。甲骨文「 史 」同「 吏 」字。《說文新附》：「𩢲，疾也，從馬，吏聲。」「 𩢲 」，《玉篇》作駛。《一切經音義》：「古使字或作駛。駛，馬行疾也」。 卜辭用作馬名，見於《合集》28195與《合集》28196。 古書用作本義，如南朝梁簡文帝〈春日想上林〉：「香車雲母幰，駛馬黃金羈」；亦用作疾速，如王維〈贈從第司庫員外絿〉：「欲緩攜手朝，流年一何駛」。
Oracle and seal script start with the sound of " horse" and " history". The original meaning is horse walking fast, and then it is extended to speed, and it is also extended to drive and drive. The word " history" in oracle bone inscriptions is the same as " official". "Shuowen New Attachment": "𩢲, Jiye, from the horse, the official voice." " 𩢲", "Jade Pian" for driving. "All Classics Sounds and Meanings": "Ancient ambassadors may be used for driving. When driving, horses are fast. Inscriptions used as horse names are found in "He Ji" 28195 and "He Ji" 28196. Ancient books are used as the original meaning, such as Emperor Liang Jianwen of the Southern Dynasties "Chunri Wants to Go to the Forest": "Xiang Che Mica, Driving Horse Golden Restraint"; also used for speed, such as Wang Wei "Gift from the Treasurer Waiyu": "Want to join hands with the court slowly" How to drive the fleeting years."

駛字的基本解释

駛
shǐ
见“驶”。

駛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shǐ］
［《廣韻》踈士切，上止，生。］
“驶1”的繁体字。
(1)马行疾速。泛指疾行。
(2)疾速。
(3)行驶。
(4)使者；铺卒。

駛字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【馬字部】　駛； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1437第02
【廣韻】疎事切【集韻】【韻會】爽士切【正韻】師止切，?音史。【玉篇】疾也。【增韻】馬行疾也。　又【正韻】式至切，音試。與?同。
